metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10648 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
Das U-Boot through 2020.01 allows attackers to bypass verified boot restrictions and subsequently boot arbitrary images by providing a crafted FIT image to a system configured to boot the default configuration.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10648` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

u-boot - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
u-boot-amlogic - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
u-boot-exynos - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
u-boot-imx - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
u-boot-mvebu - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
u-boot-omap - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
u-boot-qcom - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
u-boot-qemu - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
u-boot-rockchip - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
u-boot-rpi - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
u-boot-sifive - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
u-boot-sunxi - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
u-boot-tegra - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
u-boot-tools - 2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: u-boot package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2021.01+dfsg-3ubuntu0~20.04.3').
